speaker: quince
dialog: Pat, pat. And here's a marvels convenient place for our rehearsal.

speaker: quince
dialog: This green plot shall be our stage, this hawthorn brake our tiring-house, and we will do it in action as we will do it before the Duke.

speaker: bottom
dialog: There are things in this comedy of Pyramus and Thisbe that will never please. First, Pyramus must draw a sword to kill himself, which the ladies cannot abide. How answer you that?

speaker: starveling
dialog: I believe we must leave the killing out, when all is done.

speaker: bottom
dialog: Not a whit! I have a device to make all well. Write me a prologue, and let the prologue seem to say we will do no harm with our swords and that Pyramus is not killed indeed.

speaker: bottom
dialog: And, for the more better assurance, tell them that I, Pyramus, am not Pyramus, but Bottom the weaver. This will put them out of fear.

speaker: theseus
dialog:
Here comes the lovers full of joy and mirth.â€”-
Joy, gentle friends! Joy and fresh days of love
Accompany your hearts!

speaker: lysander
dialog:
More than to us
Wait in your royal walks, your board, your bed!

speaker: theseus
dialog:
Come now, what masques, what dances shall we have
To wear away this long age of three hours
Between our after-supper and bedtime?

speaker: theseus
dialog:
Where is our usual manager of mirth?
What revels are in hand? Is there no play
To ease the anguish of a torturing hour?

speaker: theseus
dialog:
Say what abridgment have you for this evening,
What masque, what music? How shall we beguile
The lazy time if not with some delight?

speaker: philostrate
dialog:
There is a brief how many sports are ripe.
Make choice of which your Highness will see first.
